holidays.name: International Burger Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the beloved burger in all its juicy, cheesy, and creative glory. Perfect for grilling aficionados and fast food lovers alike!
holidays.origin: Started by various burger enthusiasts and fast food fans to honor the iconic sandwich, International Burger Day has grown into a global celebration with burger festivals and special deals at restaurants.
holidays.funFact: The world's largest burger weighed over 2,000 pounds and required a forklift to serve!

holidays.name: Feel the Milk Day
holidays.description: An unusual awareness day encouraging people to appreciate and recognize the importance of milk in their daily nutrition and dietary choices.
holidays.origin: Originated from dairy industry advocates aiming to promote milk consumption and highlight its nutritional benefits.
holidays.funFact: Milk was one of the first superfoods and has been found in ancient Egyptian tombs nearly 4,000 years old.

holidays.name: Sackcloth and Ashes Day
holidays.description: A quirky observance referencing the ancient practice of wearing sackcloth and ashes to show remorse or mourning, but celebrated today with a humorous and theatrical twist.
holidays.origin: Inspired by biblical traditions and turned into a playful quirky holiday to make light of regrets and apology culture.
holidays.funFact: Some modern celebrants dress in burlap or paper to 'wear sackcloth' and share funny regrets on social media.

holidays.name: National Hamburger Day (UK)
holidays.description: While similar to International Burger Day, the UK marks this day with a special emphasis on British-style burgers and local twists.
holidays.origin: Created by British food promoters to celebrate homegrown burger talent and burger joints across the UK.
holidays.funFact: In the UK, you can find unique burger toppings like black pudding or Branston pickle celebrated on this day!
